intro: Diplanthera furcata, commonly known as the forked bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and related genera. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, branched pods that give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are typically hairy and alternate. Diplanthera furcata is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils.
